channel.title: Big Ambitions Foundation
channel.description: Recent content on Big Ambitions Foundation

item.title: About Us
item.description:
Big Ambitions Foundation feature news, updates, research and anaylsis as well as provides a common platform to share knowledge and latest updates about Open source Cloud, SDN/NFV, Linux, Containers and Networking technologies. The members of the Foundation analyse and perform data research to help the enterprises, startups and the businesses worldwide choose the right stack of open source technologies.

Big Ambitions Foundation helps talented and passionate newcomers build their career in Open source, Linux, Cloud, SDN / NFV, Networking by providing comprehensive, practical and hands-on training to women and students at an affordable fees. The goal of the Big Ambitions Foundation is to bridge the gap between open source and women in technology.

Our Vision

  • Provide a common platform to share knowledge and updates on the open source technologies.
  • Help talented and passionate newcomers build their career in Open source, Linux, Cloud, SDN / NFV and Networking.
  • Bridge the gap between open source and women in technology.
  • Encourage students and women in technology to get involved in open source community and contribute upstream.
  • Help the enterprises, startups and the businesses worldwide choose the right stack of open source technologies.

Our Mission

Our Mission:

  • Featuring tutorials on our focused open source technologies.
  • Analysing and performing data research to show how these new open source technologies would affect the enterprises, startups and the businesses worldwide.
  • Providing comprehensive, practical and hands-on training on our focused open source rechnologies to women and students at low cost.

Share this Page via:

item.title: Focused Open Source Technologies
item.description:
Big Ambitions Foundation is currently focusing on the Open source Cloud Computing, SDN / NFV, Linux, Containers and Networking technologies namely Linux systems (Ubuntu, RHEL, CentOS), OpenStack, OpenDaylight, Docker and Linux containers, Kubernetes, Apache Mesos, OpenShift, Vagrant, Puppet.

Become an Active Technical Contributor (ATC)

Please see CONTRIBUTING for details.

Technology Articles

Linux (RHEL, CentOS, Fedora, Ubuntu)

OpenStack

OpenDaylight

OpenShift

Docker

Kubernetes

Apache Mesos

Vagrant

Puppet


Share this Page via:

item.title: Research
item.description:
We would be publishing research and analysis articles on the focused open source technologies to help the enterprises, startups and the businesses worldwide choose the right stack of open source technologies.

Please see CONTRIBUTING for details.






Share this Page via:

item.title: Advisory Board
item.description:
Our Board of Advisors are the key decision makers of the Foundation. One member each from the founding members / sponsors are present in our Board of Advisors.








Share this Page via:

item.title: Spotlight
item.description:
Our Spotlight feature includes:

  • Interviews with the Open source developers
  • New features and tools launched at the Open source conferences / summits
  • Interviews with the passionate women in Open source technology
  • Interviews with the startups following our Research / Analysis articles






Share this Page via:

item.title: Founding Members
item.description:
Big Ambitions Foundation is currently looking for its Founding Members / Sponsors to help achieve its mission.

Benefits of becoming a Founding Member

Leadership

  • One Member from the founding members would be represented to our Board of Advisors, who will have a say in making the key decisions of our organisation. The Board of Advisors help govern the foundation and will be meeting in person annually.
  • Our organisation will showcase the importance of the open source developers employed within our founding members company and impact being made by them to the open source technologies, featuring in our spotlight feature hence representing it to the larger community.

Brand Visibility

  • As being a founding member of our organisation, you will be given the brand visibility in all our meetups and training sessions.
  • Founding members logo would be present on the lanyards of the meetups and training sessions area.
  • Founding members gain brand visibility in all the presentations and talks our team might be giving at the open source conferences and summits.
  • Founding members logo along with a link to their website would be mentioned on the front page of our website and on the sponsors page with a short introduction about the company.
  • Founding members company logo would be present on our company T-shirt provided to people at meetups, trainings and conferences.
  • Founding members logo along with a short introduction would be present on our brochure and monthly newsletter.
  • Founding members logo would be present on the certificates given to the candidates on the successful completion of the training.

Talent Acquisition

  • Our organisation would be providing space on our website for our founding members to mention job opportunities they may have within their company.
  • Our organisation would also be providing access to our database of trained candidates to shortlist them for jobs within their company.

Marketing

  • Our organisation would also be helping our founding members in marketing of their new products and services via our social media presence on LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Google+.
  • Our founding members have the opportunity to showcase their products, technologies and services at our meetup sessions.
  • We have a spotlight feature on our website for our founding members to market their open source products and technologies.
  • Our founding members would also be provided space in our monthly newsletter to market their products, services and technologies.

Share this Page via:

item.title: Trainings
item.description:
Big Ambitions Foundation offers training to Women, Students and IT Professionals at an affordable fees to help them build their career in Cloud Computing, SDN / NFV, Networking and Linux. Currently, we are focusing on Linux (RHEL, CentOS, Ubuntu), OpenStack, OpenDaylight, Docker and Linux Containers, Kubernetes, Apache Mesos.









Share this Page via:

item.title: Events
item.description:
Big Ambitions Foundation events include meetups and training sessions being organised by Big Ambitions team with the help of sponsors to spread and share the knowledge about the open source Cloud, SDN / NFV, Linux, Containers and Networking technologies.

Training Courses

Updated schedule will be mentioned soon!

Conferences / Summits

Big Ambitions Foundation is planning to have its presence to the following Summits / Conferences:

  • OpenStack Summit - 24 April 2016 - Austin
  • OSCON - 16 May 2016 - Austin
  • Dockercon US - 20 June 2016 - Seattle
  • Redhat Summit - 28 June 2016 - San Francisco
  • LinuxCon North America - 22 Aug 2016 - Toronto
  • ContainerCon North America - 22 Aug 2016 - Toronto
  • OpenDaylight Summit - 27 Sept 2016 - Seattle
  • LinuxCon Europe - 4 Oct 2016 - Berlin
  • ContainerCon Europe - 4 Oct 2016 - Berlin
  • OSCON - 17 Oct 2016 - London
  • OpenStack Summit - 24 Oct 2016 - Barcelona, Spain
  • MesosCon - 2016
  • Dockercon Europe - 2016
  • Tectonic Summit - 2016


Share this Page via:

item.title: Contact Us
item.description:
Incase of any suggestions, feedback, enquiry or sponsorship, Please drop us an email to info (at) bigambitions (dot) org.








Share this Page via:

item.title: Home
item.description:
About Big Ambitions Foundation

Big Ambitions Foundation feature news, updates, research and anaylsis as well as provides a common platform to share knowledge and latest updates about Open source Cloud, SDN/NFV, Linux, Containers and Networking technologies. The members of the Foundation analyse and perform data research to help the enterprises, startups and the businesses worldwide choose the right stack of open source technologies.

Big Ambitions Foundation helps talented and passionate newcomers build their career in Open source, Linux, Cloud, SDN / NFV, Networking by providing comprehensive, practical and hands-on training to women and students at an affordable fees. The goal of the Big Ambitions Foundation is to bridge the gap between open source and women in technology.

Our Vision

  • Provide a common platform to share knowledge and updates on the open source technologies.
  • Help talented and passionate newcomers build their career in Open source, Linux, Cloud, SDN / NFV and Networking.
  • Bridge the gap between open source and women in technology.
  • Encourage students and women in technology to get involved in open source community and contribute upstream.
  • Help the enterprises, startups and the businesses worldwide choose the right stack of open source technologies.

Our Mission

  • Featuring tutorials on our focused open source technologies.
  • Analysing and performing data research to show how these new open source technologies would affect the enterprises, startups and the businesses worldwide.
  • Providing comprehensive, practical and hands-on training on our focused open source rechnologies to women and students at low cost.

Founding Members

We are looking for Founding Members / Sponsors to join our nonprofit organisation and help us in achieving our mission. If your company is interested in becoming a Founding Member/ Sponsor at Big Ambitions Foundation, Please send us an email to info (at) bigambitions (dot) org.

Advisory Board at Big Ambitions

Big Ambitions Foundation would be governed on the policies decided by our Board of Advisors council. Our Board of Advisors includes one member from each of the founding members / sponsors, and respected experienced persons from the open source community.

Focused technologies

Big Ambitions would be currently focusing on Open Soure Cloud, SDN / NFV and Networking technologies mainly Linux systems (Ubuntu, RHEL, CentOS), OpenStack, OpenDaylight, Docker and Linux containers, Kubernetes, Apache Mesos, OpenShift, Vagrant, Puppet.

More technologies to be added soon in future!

Benefit to the Open Source world

In our training sessions, we would be encouraging the participants to contribute upstream and get involved with the larger community. This would help the open source technologies to have more contributions and in effect will increase the number of people with open source experience in the market for the companies to hire open source talent.

Also, our foundation would be working to bridge the gap between Open source and women by offering training to women at low cost.

We would also be conducting free meetups worldwide to share knowledge and latest updates about the Open source technologies which would help the people and newbies in the open source world to enhance their skills as well as learn new skills.

Benefit to the Users

Passionate Women and Students would be having the opportunity to get hands-on training on the Open source technologies at no cost and hence can make their career in Cloud Computing, SDN / NFV, Linux and Networking.

Benefit to the Startups and Enterprises

Our team would be performing data research and analysis of the open source technologies, and will publish it on our website as well as via our social media presence which would help the startups, enterprises and the businesses worldwide to choose the right stack of open source technologies for building their product.

Contact Us

If you would like to contact us for any suggestion, feedback, enquiry or sponsorship, Please feel free to send us an email to info (at) bigambitions (dot) org.


Share this Page via:

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description:
Effective Date: January 4, 2016

The Big Ambitions Foundation is committed to protecting the privacy of the site users. Big Ambitions Foundation intends to give users as much control as possible over user’s personally identifiable information, including registration data. This Privacy Statement applies to the “bigambitions.org” site and describes the information Big Ambitions Foundation collects about users and how that information may be used. This privacy policy also governs the use of information obtained by the Big Ambitions Foundation by its Founding Members / Sponsors.

Big Ambitions Foundation reserves the right to update and change this Privacy Statement from time to time. Big Ambitions reserves the right to change or update the Privacy Policy at any time without any prior notification to any person. The changed or updated privacy policy will be available here. Your continued use of our services even after the updated Privacy Policy on this page will constitute your acknowledgment of the modifications and your consent to abide and be bound by the modified / updated Privacy Policy.

NOTICE

Big Ambitions Foundation provides this Privacy Policy Statement to make users aware of Big Ambitions Foundation privacy practices, and of the choices a user may make about the way the user’s information is collected and used. Big Ambitions Foundation is not yet registered as an organisation or company in any country, once registered, we’ll update our Privacy Policy but we can’t promise to send individual notifications to the already registered users.

Children

Users represent they are of legal age to create binding and financial obligations for any liability users may incur as a result of their use of the Sites. The Sites are not directed to children under the age of 13, and Big Ambitions Foundation will never request personally identifiable information from anyone whom it knows to be under the age of 13 without verifiable parental or guardian consent. Big Ambitions Foundation does not knowingly collect, or wish to obtain, personally identifiable information from children. If Big Ambitions Foundation becomes aware that a user is under the age of 13 and has provided personally identifiable information without prior verifiable parental or guardian consent, it will remove user’s personally identifiable information from its files.

What information Big Ambitions Foundation collects

Big Ambitions Foundation may collect two types of information from users of Sites: “personally identifiable information” (such as name, email address, postal address, telephone, birth date, geographical location) and “aggregate information” (such as frequency of visits to Sites, IP address, Site pages accessed, browser type). Personally identifiable information is any piece of information which can potentially be used to uniquely identify, contact, or locate a user of the Sites. Aggregate information is non-personally identifiable/anonymous information about users of the Sites. Aggregate information is used in a collective manner and no single person can be identified by that compiled information.

However, if you provide personally identifiable information, it may also be linked with information that would otherwise be aggregate information. For example, the Sites may log your IP address, pages you have accessed, or links you click on, and store that information in connection your personally identifiable information. This is done to understand how you use the site, to assist in making the site function and in some cases it may be used to track how you arrived at one of the Sites, such as codes from affiliates that route traffic to the site.

On the Sites, users may order products or services, and register to receive materials. Personally identifiable information collected on the Sites includes community forum content, diaries, profiles, photographs, name, unique identifiers (e.g., passwords), contact and billing information (e.g., email address, postal address, telephone, fax), and transaction information. Sites may also collect your actual location by methods such as IP address, GPS, or other sensors in your device that share location information.

In order to tailor Big Ambitions Foundation’s subsequent communications to users and continuously improve the Sites’ products and services, Big Ambitions Foundation may also ask users to provide information regarding their interests, demographics, experience with its products, and detailed contact preferences.

Cookies

Big Ambitions Foundation uses cookies on the Sites. A cookie is a unique text file that may be used for data analysis, and enables a web site to tailor information presented to a user based on a user’s browsing program. Big Ambitions Foundation may use cookies to personalize a user’s pages at a Site, to remember a user when the user registers for products or services, or to track visits to a Site. If a user does not want Big Ambitions Foundation to deploy cookies in the user’s browser, the user may set the browser to reject cookies or to notify the user when a web site tries to place cookies in the browser program. Rejecting cookies may affect a user’s ability to use some of the products, features, functions, or services on a Site. Cookies do not contain personally identifiable information.

The ads appearing on the Sites are delivered to visitors by Big Ambitions Foundation, and third party web advertising partners (“Advertisers”). The third party advertising technology that Big Ambitions Foundation uses on the Sites uses information derived from a user’s visits to the Sites to target advertising within the Sites. In addition, Big Ambitions Foundation’s advertisers may use other third party advertising technology to target advertising on the Sites. In the course of serving advertisements to the Sites, Advertisers may place or recognize a unique cookie on a user’s browser. The Big Ambitions Foundation may provide Information about users’ visits to the Sites to Advertisers, such as the number of times users have viewed or clicked on an ad (but no users’ names, addresses, or other personally identifiable information), are used to serve ads to visitors. It is also possible that the Advertisers will use information gathered from your visits to other third-party websites (i.e., not under the control of the Big Ambitions Foundation) that also use the Advertisers’ services, which could potentially including personally identifiable information you provided to those third parties, in choosing what advertisements to show. Any information provided by you to the Advertisers via third-party websites would be governed by the privacy policy of those third-party websites. As with other cookies, and consistent with Big Ambitions Foundation’s policy on cookies stated above, the user may use third party browser plugins or extensions to direct their web browser to block or delete such cookies.

Log files

Big Ambitions Foundation web servers may automatically log aggregate information, such as a user’s IP address, domain name, browser type, date and time of access, and other log file data. This information may be used to analyze trends or administer the Sites. Log files do not contain personally identifiable information.

How Big Ambitions Foundation uses the information collected

Big Ambitions Foundation may use the personally identifiable information a user submits for any purposes related to Big Ambitions Foundation’s business, including, but not limited to:

  • To understand a user’s needs and create content that is relevant to the user
  • To generate statistical studies
  • To conduct market research and planning by sending user surveys
  • To notify user referrals of Big Ambitions Foundation services, information, or products when a user requests that Big Ambitions Foundation send such information to referrals
  • To improve services, information, and products
  • To help a user complete a transaction, or provide services or customer support
  • To communicate back to the user
  • To update the user on services, information, and products
  • To personalize a Site for the user
  • To notify the user of any changes with a Site which may affect the user
  • To enforce terms of use on a Site
  • To allow the user to purchase products, access services, or otherwise engage in activities the user selects

User names, identifications (“IDs”), and email addresses (as well as any additional information that a user may choose to post) may be publicly available on a Site when users voluntarily and publicly disclose personally identifiable information, such as when a user posts personally identifiable information in conjunction with content subject to an Open Source license, or as part of a message posted to a public forum or a publicly-released software application. Users may not be able to change or remove public postings once posted. Such personally identifiable information may be used by visitors of these pages to send unsolicited messages. Big Ambitions Foundation is not responsible for any consequences which may occur from the use of personally identifiable information that a user chooses to submit to public pages.

With respect to surveys, in the event that responses are publicly disclosed, users will be notified at the time they take the survey. Big Ambitions Foundation will disclose only aggregate information regarding its users, which as stated earlier is anonymous information that does not identify any specific individual. Circumstances under which Big Ambitions Foundation would publicly disclose such aggregate information include, but are not limited to, sharing survey results with the site population, providing data to Big Ambitions Foundation advertisers on user preferences and/or demographics, and publicizing overall usage data in press communications.

Where surveys allow users to submit written comments, and where Big Ambitions Foundation advises users of the possibility of such disclosure at the time they take the survey, Big Ambitions Foundation reserves the right to disclose any information provided by users, provided that no personal information identifying a specific user is disclosed. Participation in surveys is at a user’s option; Big Ambitions Foundation does not conduct mandatory surveys.

CHOICE/OPT OUT

A user makes the decision whether to proceed with any activity that requests personally identifiable information. If a user does not provide requested information, the user may not be able to complete certain transactions.

Users who use the personally identifiable information of other users agree to use such information only for:

  • Using services offered through a Site
  • Site transaction-related purposes and not for unsolicited commercial messages
  • Other purposes that the other user expressly chooses
  • Users are not licensed to add other users to a Site, even users who entered into transactions with them, or to their mail lists without consent

Big Ambitions Foundation encourages users to evaluate privacy and security policies of any of the Sites’ transaction partners before entering into transactions or choosing to disclose personally identifiable information.

Emails

Big Ambitions Foundation will not use or share the personally identifiable information provided to it online in ways unrelated to the items described above without first letting a user know and offering the user a choice except the email IDs and other personal information of the users can be shared with the Founding members / Sponsors.

Users may have the opportunity to use a service to send electronic mail to another user or email list. In such cases, a user’s valid email address and real name will be included with such messages. In order to prevent abuse, users may not opt out of such a display where possible, but may choose to refrain from using such service to transmit an email message.

Photographs

Users may have the opportunity to submit photographs to the Sites for product promotions, contests, and other purposes to be disclosed at the time of request. In these circumstances, the Sites are designed to allow the public to view, download, save, and otherwise access the photographs posted. By submitting a photograph, users waive any privacy expectations users have with respect to the security of such photographs, and Big Ambitions Foundation’s use or exploitation of users’ likeness. All photographs submitted to Big Ambitions Foundation become the property of Big Ambitions Foundation and will not be returned.

ONWARD TRANSFER

With whom may Big Ambitions Foundation share information?

Big Ambitions Foundation will not sell, rent, or lease a user’s personally identifiable information to others, except with its Founding members / sponsors and as described in this Privacy Statement. Unless Big Ambitions Foundation has a user’s permission or as required by law, Big Ambitions Foundation will only share the personally identifiable information a user provides online with other entities that are part of the Foundation and/or outside service providers who may be used to ship products, process credit cards, provide technical support, handle order processing, or otherwise act on Big Ambitions Foundation’s behalf. These third parties are prohibited from using users’ information for any other purpose, including their own marketing.

When Big Ambitions Foundation uses third parties to assist in processing a Site’s user personally identifiable information, Big Ambitions Foundation requests that they comply with Big Ambitions Foundation privacy practices, and other appropriate confidentiality and security measures.

Please be advised that in certain instances, it may be necessary for Big Ambitions Foundation to disclose a user’s personally identifiable information without a user’s permission to government officials or otherwise as required by legal obligations. Big Ambitions Foundation may disclose such personally identifiable information when responding to court orders, or legal process, or to establish or exercise legal rights or defend against claims, including fraud or infringement investigations.

Data collected online may be combined with information a user provides through other means of communication, such as postal mail or third parties to further carry out the purposes described above under the heading “How Big Ambitions Foundation uses the information collected”.

When users choose to provide Big Ambitions Foundation with personally identifiable information, users consent to the transfer and storage of such information by Big Ambitions Foundation servers anywhere in the world.

In addition, Big Ambitions Foundation reserves the right to share aggregate information collected from users of the Sites, without prior notice, with entities that are part of the Big Ambitions Foundation and unrelated third parties. As stated earlier, aggregate information is used in a collective manner and no single person can be identified by such compiled information.

Information Storage

Your Personal information may be stored and maintained on servers / computers located outside of your state / country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may be different than those from your jurisdiction. Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by the submission of your personal information represents your agreement to the storage of information outside your jurisdiction.

Service Orders

To purchase services, users may be asked to be directed to a third party site, like PayPal, to pay for their purchases. If applicable, the third party site may collect payment information directly to facilitate a transaction. None of this information will be captured or stored by Big Ambitions Foundation.

Use of Information to Service Providers

We may employ third party companies and/or individuals to facilitate our service, provide the services on our behalf and/or assist us in analyzing how our service is used. These third parties have access to your Personal Information only to perform specific tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to use or disclose your Personal information for any reason.

Links to third party web sites

Links to third party web sites on the Sites are provided solely as a convenience to the user. When a user uses these links, the user leaves the Sites. Big Ambitions Foundation has not reviewed all of these third party sites, does not control, and is not responsible for, any of the third party sites, their content or privacy practices. Big Ambitions Foundation does not endorse or make any representations about the third party sites, or any information, services, or products found on the sites. If a user decides to access any of the linked sites, Big Ambitions Foundation encourages the user to read their privacy statements. The user accesses such sites at user’s own risk.

Bankruptcy or Sale of business

Big Ambitions Foundation reserves the right to share or transfer personally identifiable information and aggregate information to a third party should Big Ambitions Foundation ever file for bankruptcy or in the event of a sale, merger or acquisition of Big Ambitions Foundation, provided such third party agrees to adhere to the terms of this Privacy Statement.

Changes to this Privacy Policy

Big Ambitions Foundation may amend this policy occasionally. Big Ambitions reserves the right to change or update the Privacy Policy at any time without any prior notification to any person. The changed or updated privacy policy will be available here. Your continued use of our services even after the updated Privacy Policy on this page will constitute your acknowledgment of the modifications and your consent to abide and be bound by the modified / updated Privacy Policy.

Feedback

If you have any questions regarding this Privacy Statement or Big Ambitions Foundation’s use of personal information on this site, please contact us at info (at) bigambitions (dot) org.

DATA INTEGRITY AND ACCESS

Should a user find inaccuracies in such user’s information, or desire to close an account or view the personally identifiable information Big Ambitions Foundation may have regarding the user, the user may contact Big Ambitions Foundation through the communication methods described below, or when technically feasible, directly on a Site. Big Ambitions Foundation will make commercially reasonable efforts to respond to requests for access within thirty (30) days of receiving requests. Big Ambitions Foundation may decline to process users’ access or update requests to their personally identifiable information if the requests require disproportionate technical effort, jeopardize the privacy of other users, or are impractical (for instance, requests concerning information residing on backup tapes).

SECURITY

To prevent unauthorized access or disclosure, maintain data accuracy, and ensure the appropriate use of information, Big Ambitions Foundation implements physical, electronic, and managerial procedures to safeguard and secure the information Big Ambitions Foundation collects. However, Big Ambitions Foundation does not guarantee that unauthorized third parties will never defeat measures taken to prevent improper use of personally identifiable information.

User passwords are keys to accounts. Use unique numbers, letters, and special characters for passwords and do not disclose passwords to other people in order to prevent loss of account control. Users are responsible for all actions taken in their accounts. Notify Big Ambitions Foundation of any password compromises, and change passwords periodically to maintain account protection.

The security of your Personal Information is highly important to us and we strive to implement and maintain reasonable, commercially acceptable security procedures and practices in order to protect your information from unauthorized access, destruction, use or disclosure. However, Please be aware that no method of transmission and storage of information over the internet is 100 percent secure. Hence, we are unable to guarantee the absolute security of your Personal Information.

ENFORCEMENT

In the event Big Ambitions Foundation becomes aware that the security of a Site has been compromised or user’s personally identifiable information has been disclosed to unrelated third parties as a result of external activity, including but not limited to security attacks or fraud, Big Ambitions Foundation reserves the right to take reasonable appropriate measures, including but not limited to, investigation and reporting, and notification to and cooperation with law enforcement authorities.

This site currently do not respond to any “do not track” signals that may be communicated by a web browser. The Sites may use third-party “plug-in” services on the Sites, such as those for social media sites or for website analytics. These third party services may use cookies or other technologies to track your web site usage over time and across different Web sites.

CONTACT INFORMATION

If a user has comments or questions about the Big Ambitions Foundation’s privacy statement, please contact us at info (at) bigambitions (dot) org.

item.title: Terms of Use
item.description:
January 4th, 2015

By using Big Ambitions Foundation website you are agreeing to be bound by the following terms and conditions here:

Here’s the basic idea:

  • Don’t violate anyone’s intellectual property and post anyone else’s copyrighted or confidential material you don’t have permission to use.
  • Don’t post anything vulgar, inflammatory, pornographic, etc.
  • Don’t post spam.
  • Too many metalinks and tags are not accepted. If you try to boost your SEO, that’s an abuse of the system.
  • Don’t post just to sell something. Sure, talk up your project, but don’t mention how to buy it every single time.
  • Don’t launch into personal attacks. You’re not going to agree with everyone, but name-calling will just cause trouble and will be regarded as flaming behavior.
  • Tone down the foul language. You can say what you need to say without relying on cursing. In fact, your writing will be regarded as that much more creative.

Big Ambitions Foundation Terms of Use

The Big Ambitions Foundation and its website provide a framework for discussion and user generated information to expand the knowledge base of open source information. Please note that articles, as well as any other user content on bigambitions.org (such as blogs, directory content, forums, comments, etc.), do not reflect the views or endorsements of the Big Ambitions Foundation, its staff, or its members. We recognize there may be inaccurate information reflected in this site and that users should understand that something that appears on bigambitions.org does not mean the Big Ambitions Foundation has vetted or endorsed that content.

Big Ambitions Foundation reserves the right to take down anything you post on this site, for these or other reasons. If you don’t agree to these terms, don’t use this website. Violation of the terms in this document may result in the removal of the content and a warning from the site’s administrators.

Terms and Conditions of Use for the Big Ambitions Foundation’s Web Sites

BY ACCESSING, BROWSING OR USING THIS WEB SITE, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTAND AND AGREE TO BE BOUND BY THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

This Web site is a service made available by the Big Ambitions Foundation. All software, documentation, information and/or other materials provided on and through this Web site (“Content”) may be used solely under the following terms and conditions (“Terms of Use”).

This Web site may contain other proprietary notices and copyright information, the terms of which must be observed and followed. The Content on this Web site may contain technical inaccuracies or typographical errors and may be changed or updated without notice. The Big Ambitions Foundation may also make improvements and/or changes to the Content at any time without notice.

The Big Ambitions Foundation and its members (“Members”) assume no responsibility regarding the accuracy of the Content and use of the Content is at the recipient’s own risk. The Big Ambitions Foundation and the Members provide no assurances that any reported problems with any Content will be resolved.

Intellectual Property Rights

All logos and trademarks contained on this Web site are and remain the property of their respective owners. No licenses or other rights in or to such logos and/or trademarks are granted.

Except as otherwise expressly stated, by providing the Content, neither the Big Ambitions Foundation nor the Members grant any licenses to any copyrights, patents or any other intellectual property rights.

Users Submissions

Users are solely responsible for all materials, whether publicly posted or privately transmitted, that users upload, post, e-mail, transmit, or otherwise make available on our site (“User Content”). Neither the Big Ambitions Foundation nor any of its Members shall be liable for any claims arising out of User Content. You warrant that you have all rights needed to provide the User Content in accordance with these terms and all applicable laws or regulations.

Projects that may be hosted by the Big Ambitions Foundation may have license terms or Contributor Agreements that are specific to the Workgroup or project and may require Users to sign an agreement (such as a Contributor Agreement) assigning and/or licensing rights in submissions made to such Workgroup or project. In all such cases, and to the extent there is a conflict, those license terms or agreements take precedence over these Terms of Use.

With respect to any User Content not governed by other Workgroup or project specific terms or agreements, you agree that the following non-exclusive, irrevocable, royalty-free worldwide licenses shall apply:

Code Submissions. User Content in the form of source or object code will be governed by the BSD License.

All Other Submissions. User Content that is not in the form of source or object code, including but not limited to white papers, dissertations, articles or other literary works, power point presentations, encyclopedias, anthologies, wikis, blogs, diagrams, drawings, sketches, photos or other images, audio content, video content and audiovisual materials, will be governed by the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0.

The Big Ambitions Foundation and the Members do not want to receive confidential information from you through this Web site. Please note that any information or material sent to the Big Ambitions Foundation or the Members will be deemed NOT to be confidential.

You are prohibited from posting or transmitting to or from this Web site any unlawful, threatening, libelous, defamatory, obscene, scandalous, inflammatory, pornographic, or profane material, or any other material that could give rise to any civil or criminal liability under the law.

Disclaimers and Limitations of Liability

The Big Ambitions Foundation and the Members make no representations whatsoever about any other Web site that you may access through this Web site. When you access a non-Big Ambitions Foundation Web site, even one that may contain the organization’s name or mark, please understand that it is independent from the Big Ambitions Foundation, and that the Big Ambitions Foundation and the Members have no control over the content on such Web site.
